textBoxData.title: What a view!
textBoxData.content:
Oh, look at that! Looks like we are going further away from the Earth! Hope we don’t encounter any abandoned satellites on the way!

*When satellites stop working, they are left in space . They are called space debris and there are 20 000 artificial objects in the Earth orbit alone.*

triviaData.title: What is Mars sometimes called?
triviaData.question: Pick answer
triviaData.explanation: Mars is a cold desert world. It is half the size of Earth. Mars is sometimes called the Red Planet. It's red because of rusty iron in the ground. One day on Mars lasts 24.6 hours. It is just a little longer than a day on Earth. One year on Mars is 687 Earth days. It is almost twice as long as one year on Earth.

triviaData.title: Why is earth called an ocean planet?
triviaData.question: Because water covers .... of Earth's surface
triviaData.explanation: Note: Earth has a lot of water. It's one of the things that makes our big, blue planet so special. Our home planet Earth is a rocky, terrestrial planet. It has a solid and active surface with mountains, valleys, canyons, plains and so much more. Earth is special because it is an ocean planet. Water covers 70% of Earth's surface. Earth has just one Moon. It is the only planet to have just one moon.

triviaData.title: How long does it take for Mercury to orbit around the Sun (in earth days)?
triviaData.question: Pick answer
triviaData.explanation:
How long is a year on other planets? Well, it depends on where they are orbiting! The closer a planet travels to the Sun, the more the Sun’s gravity can pull on the planet. The stronger the pull of the Sun’s gravity, the faster the planet orbits. Mercury is the closest planet to the sun (distance ~35 million miles (58 million km)) so it’s the shortest answer.


Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system. It’s just a little bigger than Earth’s moon. It is the closest planet to the sun, but it’s actually not the hottest. Venus is hotter.

triviaData.title: Is there are weather in space?
triviaData.question: Pick an answer
triviaData.explanation: Yes, Space Weather exits! Activity on the Sun’s surface creates a type of weather called space weather. The Sun is really far away—about 93 million miles (150 million kilometers)—from Earth. However, space weather can affect Earth and the rest of the solar system. At its worst, it can even damage satellites and cause electrical blackouts on Earth! Solar storms happen suddenly, and their effects can reach Earth within minutes. But scientists do make predictions about when solar storms are likely to occur and how strong they will be. You can check the space weather forecast just like you might check the weather forecast. NASA and other agencies operate a collection of instruments that keep an eye on the Sun and space weather.
